mechanics.condition: Target location is within range AND (familiar to caster OR an obvious unfamiliar location)
mechanics.outcome: Invisible sensor is created at target location for the duration
Sensor cannot be attacked or otherwise interacted with
Caster chooses to use either seeing or hearing through the sensor as if in its space
Caster can switch between seeing and hearing through the sensor

mechanics.condition: Creature has See Invisibility OR Truesight OR similar ability
mechanics.outcome: Sensor is seen as a luminous, intangible orb about the size of a fist

description_text: You create an invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The sensor remains in place for the duration, and it can't be attacked or otherwise interacted with. When you cast the spell, you choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As your action, you can switch between seeing and hearing. A creature that can see the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from see invisibility or truesight) sees a luminous, intangible orb about the size of your fist.
